flow.descriptionCdata:
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.0386ef28-867a-473a-9ff6-93a1dc58e317.description=
Allows a user to select how they should be notified of the outcome of a flow, and shows them a message in that way.

Inputs\:
notifyData -  The text of the notification message.
notifyMethod - The method of notification (Write to File, Email, Display or None). This value is case-insensitive.
subject - A description of what the notification is about. 
destination - The destination of the notification (email address or filename). This field is required when notifyMethod is Email or Write to File.
notificationServer - The email server to send the notification through. This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
from - The originator of the message (email "from" address).This field is required when notifyMethod is Email.
serverPort - The port the service to notify on the server is running on. This field used when notifyMethod is Email, and it is optional (it defaults to 25 if not specified).
htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.

Responses\:
success - The user was notified.
failure - Notification failed.

As mentioned above, some inputs are required for certain types of notification methods. In order to schedule a flow that in turn uses this flow, all of the required fields for the given notification method must be supplied, or else the flow will not be able to execute to completion. For example, if "notifyMethod" is "File", then the "destination" input must also be specified.
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.0d7c573c-b595-49be-a2dc-4d6b9ecb221c.description=
Using the HP Operation "Generate Run URL" to determine HistoryID

Author\: Andy Roth

Inputs are the out of the box inputs for variablename and display text.

Result\: historyId - this is a regex (\d+$) filtered result to pull historyId from URL
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.171dd10f-b7ed-4702-a46f-7a059f81f2a9.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.4486ba2b-28ad-4739-b1a6-89bdc23599a8.description=
Operation to check for null or empty string local variables.

Inputs\:

inputList\:  comma seperated list of variables to check

Reponsses\:
hasNull\:  at least one variable is null or has an empy string for a value
noNulls\:  all variables have a value

Result\:  List of variables that are null or empty strings
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.68c8dc67-caf7-4cf2-be1f-645276af6613.description=Releases a lock with an id given by the value of the lockId input. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.

Responses\:
   success - the only response returned.

Results\:
   there are no results.

Notes\:
1) The operation only releases locks acquired by the current run. 
   It cannot release another run's locks.

2) The operation succeeds whether or not there is a lock held 
   by the current run with the supplied id.

fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.bcf18149-9bc9-453a-8bb6-18f31b521152.description=
Sleeps for "X" seconds.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for "X" seconds.
failure - was unable to sleep for some reason
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.d92733de-66ed-4e4c-87ca-daf3bf94f6e1.description=
OPerations that takes in variable names as inputs, url encodes those inputs and appends them in the appropriate format to the base url provided

Result called Result will be base url + query params
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.description=This flow will grab a lock and hold it for specified time (sec), then release it. The purpose is to be used as a QA test flow to intentionally grab a lock to create required test conditions. *** This flow is NOT intended for use in production environments. *** fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.e0556011-5bf0-4e0f-b0ca-9e6454f7edcf.description=Attempts acquisition of a lock with an id given by the value of the lockId input. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.

Responses\:
   success - if the lock has been successfully acquired.
   failure - if the lock has already been acquired.

Result\:
   there are no results.

Notes\:

1) The operation does not block waiting for a lock to become available.

2) The locks acquired by this operation are not reentrant. This means that 
   once a lock is acquired by a run, all subsequent attempts at acquiring 
   the same lock by the same run (or any other run) will fail.

3) Once a run terminates, all the locks that were acquired during its execution
   are automatically released.
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.f3048c56-eed4-45a3-95a0-955cde941801.description=Releases a lock with an id given by the value of the lockId input. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.

Responses\:
   success - the only response returned.

Results\:
   there are no results.

Notes\:
1) The operation only releases locks acquired by the current run. 
   It cannot release another run's locks.

2) The operation succeeds whether or not there is a lock held 
   by the current run with the supplied id.
fd2e5dd3-d8fa-49ea-bb2f-6a152af3d4c6.ffd6c599-901b-4111-a749-134f973635f5.description=
This is an operation that does nothing, and can be used to display information to the user by editing the display tab. It can also be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs, and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
flow.name: getLockAndHold

staticBinding.value: Failed to encode vars for URL.

RunHistId# ${historyId}
Run Report: ${reportUrl}
URL to Re-Run: ${cleanupUrl}

Error Message: ${errorInfo}
Error Details: 
${errorDetails}

DEBUG INFO _ INPUTS RECEIVED:
lockParam = ${lockParam}
holdTime = ${holdTime}
